static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SearchEngineSettings> loadSettings(java.io.File settingsFile)
          Load a search engine settings file with fields of the form: name | queryPrefix | queryPostfix | resultLinkKey | nextResultsPageKey Where name -- is the name and key for the setting. queryPrefix -- is the constant portion of a query url before a query's text. queryPostfix -- is the constant portion of a query url after a query's text. resultLinkKey -- is the (sd) xPath to identify result (hit) links from the search engine. nextResutlsPageKey -- is the (sd) xPath to identify getting the "next" page of results from the search engine. lowContentBrNum -- is the number of the br node in the content at which the body text starts. highContentBrNum -- is the number of the br node in the content at which the body text ends. Note that blank lines and lines beginning with '#' are ignored.

getDefaultSettings

public static final SearchEngineSettings getDefaultSettings(java.lang.String name)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
Get default search engine settings for the given name (e.g. "google", "google-blog", ...).

See the default settings file at resources/settings/default_search_engine_settings.txt

Throws:
java.io.IOException

loadSettings

public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SearchEngineSettings> loadSettings(java.io.File settingsFile)
                                                                               throws java.io.IOException
Load a search engine settings file with fields of the form: name | queryPrefix | queryPostfix | resultLinkKey | nextResultsPageKey Where
  • name -- is the name and key for the setting.
  • queryPrefix -- is the constant portion of a query url before a query's text.
  • queryPostfix -- is the constant portion of a query url after a query's text.
  • resultLinkKey -- is the (sd) xPath to identify result (hit) links from the search engine.
  • nextResutlsPageKey -- is the (sd) xPath to identify getting the "next" page of results from the search engine.
  • lowContentBrNum -- is the number of the br node in the content at which the body text starts.
  • highContentBrNum -- is the number of the br node in the content at which the body text ends.
Note that blank lines and lines beginning with '#' are ignored.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
